availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson, Kentucky, enslaved man. Owned by Seraphina Pentecost in Henderson County, Kentucky c.1858. Escaped to Indiana in 1859. Owned by Seraphina Pentecost in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Escaped in 1861. Murdered Walter A. Norwood in April 1861.

ab.bibl:
_Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Posey County, Mount Vernon, p. 676. Robert Glass to Beriah Magoffin, 4 April 1861, “Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1859-1862,” MG8-112 to MG8-113, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, KY, Accessed via the Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition,
discovery.civilwargovernors.org/document/KYR-0001-021-0028. Emily Moses, “On the Border of Freedom,”Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition blog, September 24, 2018, accessed April 11, 2019, http://civilwargovernors.org/on-the-border-of-freedom/.
